title: Illicit Wealth Acquisition Case Against Cholendra Shumsher JB Rana
description:
This case involves allegations of corruption and illicit wealth acquisition against former Chief Justice of Nepal, Cholendra Shumsher JB Rana. Formal investigations were initiated following complaints filed by medical reform activist Dr. Govinda KC, the Nepal Bar Association (NBA), and other civil society groups in late 2021.

The primary investigating bodies are the Department of Money Laundering Investigation (DMLI) and a parliamentary Impeachment Recommendation Committee. The DMLI launched its probe on December 30, 2021, focusing on the assets of Rana's family members.

On February 13, 2022, an impeachment motion was filed against Rana by 98 lawmakers, leading to his immediate suspension as Chief Justice. A parliamentary committee was subsequently formed to investigate the charges outlined in the motion and a 35-point memorandum submitted by the NBA. Rana officially retired on December 13, 2022, while still under suspension and investigation.
unverified_info:
The following are specific but unproven allegations raised during the investigations:

  • Rana is alleged to have purchased two plots of land (kitta no. 109 and 110) in Thamel, Kathmandu, in his wife Reji Rana's name around 2008-2009. The purchase was allegedly financed with crores of rupees embezzled during his tenure as a judge at the Special Court.
  • His brother, Prabhu Shumsher Rana, is accused of managing bribery operations from a rented office on his behalf.
  • Several individuals have been named as alleged intermediaries for handling bribes, including a Lalitpur-based trader known as 'Ghyu Sahu', Amit Shrestha, and Dipak Timilsina.
  • The Nepal Bar Association accused Rana of soliciting bribes from candidates for judicial appointments and promotions.
  • He is specifically accused of receiving a bribe from Krishna Bahadur Giri (aka Siddha Baba) and subsequently pressuring a lower court judge to deliver a favorable verdict in his case.
key_allegations: Illicit wealth acquisition and money laundering
Abuse of authority and judicial corruption
Taking bribes for favorable verdicts and judicial appointments
Using family members and intermediaries to manage illicit funds
Compromising the separation of powers by seeking a share in the government cabinet

timeline.title: Appointed Chief Justice
timeline.description: Cholendra Shumsher Rana was appointed Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of Nepal.

timeline.title: Protests Begin
timeline.description: The Nepal Bar Association (NBA) and a majority of Supreme Court justices began protests against Rana, demanding his resignation over allegations of corruption and misconduct.

timeline.title: Formal Complaint Filed at DMLI
timeline.description: Dr. Govinda KC, representing the 'Broad Citizens' Movement,' filed a formal complaint at the Department of Money Laundering Investigation (DMLI) against Rana, demanding a probe into his assets.

timeline.title: DMLI Initiates Investigation
timeline.description: The DMLI confirmed the start of an investigation into the wealth of Rana's family members and relatives, appointing investigating officers for the probe.

timeline.title: Impeachment Motion and Suspension
timeline.description: A total of 98 lawmakers from the ruling coalition registered an impeachment motion against Rana in Parliament, leading to his immediate suspension from the post of Chief Justice.

timeline.title: Impeachment Committee Formed
timeline.description: A parliamentary Impeachment Recommendation Committee was formed to investigate the charges leveled against Rana in the impeachment motion.

timeline.title: NBA Submits Memorandum to Committee
timeline.description: The Nepal Bar Association submitted a detailed 35-point letter to the Impeachment Recommendation Committee, outlining specific allegations of corruption, irregularities, and misconduct against Rana.

timeline.title: Rana Testifies Before Committee
timeline.description: Rana began appearing before the Impeachment Recommendation Committee to provide his statement and defend himself against the allegations. The hearings continued through September.

timeline.title: Retirement from Judiciary
timeline.description: Cholendra Shumsher Rana officially retired from the judiciary upon reaching the mandatory retirement age of 65, while still under suspension.
